83 /* could leading zeros */
84 static inline int clz(limb_t a)
85 {
86  if (a == 0) {
87  return LIMB_BITS;
88  } else {
89 #if LIMB_BITS == 64
90  return clz64(a);
91 #else
92  return clz32(a);
93 #endif
94  }
95 }
96 
97 static inline int ctz(limb_t a)
98 {
99  if (a == 0) {
100  return LIMB_BITS;
101  } else {
102 #if LIMB_BITS == 64
103  return ctz64(a);
104 #else
105  return ctz32(a);
106 #endif
107  }
108 }

110 static inline int ceil_log2(limb_t a)
111 {
112  if (a <= 1)
113  return 0;
114  else
115  return LIMB_BITS - clz(a - 1);
116 }

127 static inline slimb_t floor_div(slimb_t a, limb_t b)
128 {
129  if (a >= 0) {
130  return a / b;
131  } else {
132  return (a - b + 1) / (slimb_t)b;
133  }
134 }

165 void bf_init(bf_context_t *s, bf_t *r)
166 {
167  r->ctx = s;
168  r->sign = 0;
169  r->expn = BF_EXP_ZERO;
170  r->len = 0;
171  r->tab = NULL;
172 }

174 void bf_resize(bf_t *r, limb_t len)
175 {
176  if (len != r->len) {
177  r->tab = bf_realloc(r->ctx, r->tab, len * sizeof(limb_t));
178  r->len = len;
179  }
180 }

182 void bf_set_ui(bf_t *r, uint64_t a)
183 {
184  r->sign = 0;
185  if (a == 0) {
186  r->expn = BF_EXP_ZERO;
187  bf_resize(r, 0);
188  }
189 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
190  else if (a <= 0xffffffff)
191 #else
192  else
193 #endif
194  {
195  int shift;
196  bf_resize(r, 1);
197  shift = clz(a);
198  r->tab[0] = a << shift;
199  r->expn = LIMB_BITS - shift;
200  }
201 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
202  else {
203  uint32_t a1, a0;
204  int shift;
205  bf_resize(r, 2);
206  a0 = a;
207  a1 = a >> 32;
208  shift = clz(a1);
209  r->tab[0] = a0 << shift;
210  r->tab[1] = (a1 << shift) | (a0 >> (LIMB_BITS - shift));
211  r->expn = 2 * LIMB_BITS - shift;
212  }
213 #endif
214 }

219  bf_set_ui(r, -a);

221  } else {
222  bf_set_ui(r, a);

224 }

247 void bf_set(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a)
248 {
249  if (r == a)
250  return;
251  r->sign = a->sign;
252  r->expn = a->expn;
253  bf_resize(r, a->len);
254  memcpy(r->tab, a->tab, a->len * sizeof(limb_t));
255 }

257 /* equivalent to bf_set(r, a); bf_delete(a) */
258 void bf_move(bf_t *r, bf_t *a)
259 {
260  bf_context_t *s = r->ctx;
261  if (r == a)
262  return;
263  bf_free(s, r->tab);
264  *r = *a;
265 }

267 static limb_t get_limbz(const bf_t *a, limb_t idx)
268 {
269  if (idx >= a->len)
270  return 0;
271  else
272  return a->tab[idx];
273 }

275 /* get LIMB_BITS at bit position 'pos' in tab */
276 static inline limb_t get_bits(const limb_t *tab, limb_t len, slimb_t pos)
277 {
278  limb_t i, a0, a1;
279  int p;
280 
281  i = pos >> LIMB_LOG2_BITS;
282  p = pos & (LIMB_BITS - 1);
283  if (i < len)
284  a0 = tab[i];
285  else
286  a0 = 0;
287  if (p == 0) {
288  return a0;
289  } else {
290  i++;
291  if (i < len)
292  a1 = tab[i];
293  else
294  a1 = 0;
295  return (a0 >> p) | (a1 << (LIMB_BITS - p));
296  }
297 }
298 
299 static inline limb_t get_bit(const limb_t *tab, limb_t len, slimb_t pos)
300 {
301  slimb_t i;
302  i = pos >> LIMB_LOG2_BITS;
303  if (i < 0 || i >= len)
304  return 0;
305  return (tab[i] >> (pos & (LIMB_BITS - 1))) & 1;
306 }
307 
308 static inline limb_t limb_mask(int start, int last)
309 {
310  limb_t v;
311  int n;
312  n = last - start + 1;
313  if (n == LIMB_BITS)
314  v = -1;
315  else
316  v = (((limb_t)1 << n) - 1) << start;
317  return v;
318 }
319 
320 /* return != 0 if one bit between 0 and bit_pos inclusive is not zero. */
321 static inline limb_t scan_bit_nz(const bf_t *r, slimb_t bit_pos)
322 {
323  slimb_t pos;
324  limb_t v;
325 
326  pos = bit_pos >> LIMB_LOG2_BITS;
327  if (pos < 0)
328  return 0;
329  v = r->tab[pos] & limb_mask(0, bit_pos & (LIMB_BITS - 1));
330  if (v != 0)
331  return 1;
332  pos--;
333  while (pos >= 0) {
334  if (r->tab[pos] != 0)
335  return 1;
336  pos--;
337  }
338  return 0;
339 }
340 
341 /* return the addend for rounding. Note that prec can be <= 0 for bf_rint() */
342 static int bf_get_rnd_add(int *pret, const bf_t *r, limb_t l,
343  slimb_t prec, int rnd_mode)
344 {
345  int add_one, inexact;
346  limb_t bit1, bit0;
347 
348  if (rnd_mode == BF_RNDF) {
349  bit0 = 1; /* faithful rounding does not honor the INEXACT flag */
350  } else {
351  /* starting limb for bit 'prec + 1' */
352  bit0 = scan_bit_nz(r, l * LIMB_BITS - 1 - bf_max(0, prec + 1));
353  }
354 
355  /* get the bit at 'prec' */
356  bit1 = get_bit(r->tab, l, l * LIMB_BITS - 1 - prec);
357  inexact = (bit1 | bit0) != 0;
358 
359  add_one = 0;
360  switch(rnd_mode) {
361  case BF_RNDZ:
362  break;
363  case BF_RNDN:
364  if (bit1) {
365  if (bit0) {
366  add_one = 1;
367  } else {
368  /* round to even */
369  add_one =
370  get_bit(r->tab, l, l * LIMB_BITS - 1 - (prec - 1));
371  }
372  }
373  break;
374  case BF_RNDD:
375  case BF_RNDU:
376  if (r->sign == (rnd_mode == BF_RNDD))
377  add_one = inexact;
378  break;
379  case BF_RNDNA:
380  case BF_RNDF:
381  add_one = bit1;
382  break;
383  case BF_RNDNU:
384  if (bit1) {
385  if (r->sign)
386  add_one = bit0;
387  else
388  add_one = 1;
389  }
390  break;
391  default:
392  abort();
393  }
394 
395  if (inexact)
396  *pret |= BF_ST_INEXACT;
397  return add_one;
398 }
399 
400 static int bf_set_overflow(bf_t *r, int sign, limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags)
401 {
402  slimb_t i, l, e_max;
403  int rnd_mode;
404 
405  rnd_mode = flags & BF_RND_MASK;
406  if (prec == BF_PREC_INF ||
407  rnd_mode == BF_RNDN ||
408  rnd_mode == BF_RNDNA ||
409  rnd_mode == BF_RNDNU ||
410  (rnd_mode == BF_RNDD && sign == 1) ||
411  (rnd_mode == BF_RNDU && sign == 0)) {
412  bf_set_inf(r, sign);
413  } else {
414  /* set to maximum finite number */
415  l = (prec + LIMB_BITS - 1) / LIMB_BITS;
416  bf_resize(r, l);
417  r->tab[0] = limb_mask((-prec) & (LIMB_BITS - 1),
418  LIMB_BITS - 1);
419  for(i = 1; i < l; i++)
420  r->tab[i] = (limb_t)-1;
421  e_max = (limb_t)1 << (bf_get_exp_bits(flags) - 1);
422  r->expn = e_max;
423  r->sign = sign;
424  }
425  return BF_ST_OVERFLOW | BF_ST_INEXACT;
426 }
427 
428 /* round to prec1 bits assuming 'r' is non zero and finite. 'r' is
429  assumed to have length 'l'. Note: 'prec1' can be negative or
430  infinite (BF_PREC_INF). */
431 static int __bf_round(bf_t *r, limb_t prec1, bf_flags_t flags, limb_t l)
432 {
433  limb_t v, a;
434  int shift, add_one, ret, rnd_mode;
435  slimb_t i, bit_pos, pos, e_min, e_max, e_range, prec;
436 
437  /* e_min and e_max are computed to match the IEEE 754 conventions */
438  e_range = (limb_t)1 << (bf_get_exp_bits(flags) - 1);
439  e_min = -e_range + 3;
440  e_max = e_range;
441 
442  if (unlikely(r->expn < e_min) && (flags & BF_FLAG_SUBNORMAL)) {
443  /* restrict the precision in case of potentially subnormal
444  result */
445  prec = prec1 - (e_min - r->expn);
446  } else {
447  prec = prec1;
448  }
449 
450  /* round to prec bits */
451  rnd_mode = flags & BF_RND_MASK;
452  ret = 0;
453  add_one = bf_get_rnd_add(&ret, r, l, prec, rnd_mode);
454 
455  if (prec <= 0) {
456  if (add_one) {
457  bf_resize(r, 1);
458  r->tab[0] = (limb_t)1 << (LIMB_BITS - 1);
459  r->expn += 1 - prec;
460  ret |= BF_ST_UNDERFLOW | BF_ST_INEXACT;
461  return ret;
462  } else {
463  goto underflow;
464  }
465  } else if (add_one) {
466  limb_t carry;
467 
468  /* add one starting at digit 'prec - 1' */
469  bit_pos = l * LIMB_BITS - 1 - (prec - 1);
470  pos = bit_pos >> LIMB_LOG2_BITS;
471  carry = (limb_t)1 << (bit_pos & (LIMB_BITS - 1));
472 
473  for(i = pos; i < l; i++) {
474  v = r->tab[i] + carry;
475  carry = (v < carry);
476  r->tab[i] = v;
477  if (carry == 0)
478  break;
479  }
480  if (carry) {
481  /* shift right by one digit */
482  v = 1;
483  for(i = l - 1; i >= pos; i--) {
484  a = r->tab[i];
485  r->tab[i] = (a >> 1) | (v << (LIMB_BITS - 1));
486  v = a;
487  }
488  r->expn++;
489  }
490  }
491 
492  /* check underflow */
493  if (unlikely(r->expn < e_min)) {
494  if (flags & BF_FLAG_SUBNORMAL) {
495  /* if inexact, also set the underflow flag */
496  if (ret & BF_ST_INEXACT)
497  ret |= BF_ST_UNDERFLOW;
498  } else {
499  underflow:
500  ret |= BF_ST_UNDERFLOW | BF_ST_INEXACT;
501  bf_set_zero(r, r->sign);
502  return ret;
503  }
504  }
505 
506  /* check overflow */
507  if (unlikely(r->expn > e_max))
508  return bf_set_overflow(r, r->sign, prec1, flags);
509 
510  /* keep the bits starting at 'prec - 1' */
511  bit_pos = l * LIMB_BITS - 1 - (prec - 1);
512  i = bit_pos >> LIMB_LOG2_BITS;
513  if (i >= 0) {
514  shift = bit_pos & (LIMB_BITS - 1);
515  if (shift != 0)
516  r->tab[i] &= limb_mask(shift, LIMB_BITS - 1);
517  } else {
518  i = 0;
519  }
520  /* remove trailing zeros */
521  while (r->tab[i] == 0)
522  i++;
523  if (i > 0) {
524  l -= i;
525  memmove(r->tab, r->tab + i, l * sizeof(limb_t));
526  }
527  bf_resize(r, l);
528  return ret;
529 }
530 
531 /* 'r' must be a finite number */
532 int bf_normalize_and_round(bf_t *r, limb_t prec1, bf_flags_t flags)
533 {
534  limb_t l, v, a;
535  int shift, ret;
536  slimb_t i;
537 
538  // bf_print_str("bf_renorm", r);
539  l = r->len;
540  while (l > 0 && r->tab[l - 1] == 0)
541  l--;
542  if (l == 0) {
543  /* zero */
544  r->expn = BF_EXP_ZERO;
545  bf_resize(r, 0);
546  ret = 0;
547  } else {
548  r->expn -= (r->len - l) * LIMB_BITS;
549  /* shift to have the MSB set to '1' */
550  v = r->tab[l - 1];
551  shift = clz(v);
552  if (shift != 0) {
553  v = 0;
554  for(i = 0; i < l; i++) {
555  a = r->tab[i];
556  r->tab[i] = (a << shift) | (v >> (LIMB_BITS - shift));
557  v = a;
558  }
559  r->expn -= shift;
560  }
561  ret = __bf_round(r, prec1, flags, l);
562  }
563  // bf_print_str("r_final", r);
564  return ret;
565 }
566 
567 /* return true if rounding can be done at precision 'prec' assuming
568  the exact result r is such that |r-a| <= 2^(EXP(a)-k). */
569 /* XXX: check the case where the exponent would be incremented by the
570  rounding */
571 int bf_can_round(const bf_t *a, slimb_t prec, bf_rnd_t rnd_mode, slimb_t k)
572 {
573  BOOL is_rndn;
574  slimb_t bit_pos, n;
575  limb_t bit;
576 
577  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF || a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN)
578  return FALSE;
579  if (rnd_mode == BF_RNDF) {
580  return (k >= (prec + 1));
581  }
582  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO)
583  return FALSE;
584  is_rndn = (rnd_mode == BF_RNDN || rnd_mode == BF_RNDNA ||
585  rnd_mode == BF_RNDNU);
586  if (k < (prec + 2))
587  return FALSE;
588  bit_pos = a->len * LIMB_BITS - 1 - prec;
589  n = k - prec;
590  /* bit pattern for RNDN or RNDNA: 0111.. or 1000...
591  for other rounding modes: 000... or 111...
592  */
593  bit = get_bit(a->tab, a->len, bit_pos);
594  bit_pos--;
595  n--;
596  bit ^= is_rndn;
597  /* XXX: slow, but a few iterations on average */
598  while (n != 0) {
599  if (get_bit(a->tab, a->len, bit_pos) != bit)
600  return TRUE;
601  bit_pos--;
602  n--;
603  }
604  return FALSE;
605 }
606 
607 int bf_round(bf_t *r, limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags)
608 {
609  if (r->len == 0)
610  return 0;
611  return __bf_round(r, prec, flags, r->len);
612 }

614 /* for debugging */
615 static __maybe_unused void dump_limbs(const char *str, const limb_t *tab, limb_t n)
616 {
617  limb_t i;
618  printf("%s: len=%" PRId_LIMB "\n", str, n);
619  for(i = 0; i < n; i++) {
620  printf("%" PRId_LIMB ": " FMT_LIMB "\n",
621  i, tab[i]);
622  }
623 }

625 /* for debugging */
626 void bf_print_str(const char *str, const bf_t *a)
627 {
628  slimb_t i;
629  printf("%s=", str);
630 
631  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
632  printf("NaN");
633  } else {
634  if (a->sign)
635  putchar('-');
636  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO) {
637  putchar('0');
638  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
639  printf("Inf");
640  } else {
641  printf("0x0.");
642  for(i = a->len - 1; i >= 0; i--)
643  printf(FMT_LIMB, a->tab[i]);
644  printf("p%" PRId_LIMB, a->expn);
645  }
646  }
647  printf("\n");
648 }

650 /* compare the absolute value of 'a' and 'b'. Return < 0 if a < b, 0
651  if a = b and > 0 otherwise. */
652 int bf_cmpu(const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
653 {
654  slimb_t i;
655  limb_t len, v1, v2;
656 
657  if (a->expn != b->expn) {
658  if (a->expn < b->expn)
659  return -1;
660  else
661  return 1;
662  }
663  len = bf_max(a->len, b->len);
664  for(i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
665  v1 = get_limbz(a, a->len - len + i);
666  v2 = get_limbz(b, b->len - len + i);
667  if (v1 != v2) {
668  if (v1 < v2)
669  return -1;
670  else
671  return 1;
672  }
673  }
674  return 0;
675 }
676 
677 /* Full order: -0 < 0, NaN == NaN and NaN is larger than all other numbers */
678 int bf_cmp_full(const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
679 {
680  int res;
681 
682  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN || b->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
683  if (a->expn == b->expn)
684  res = 0;
685  else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN)
686  res = 1;
687  else
688  res = -1;
689  } else if (a->sign != b->sign) {
690  res = 1 - 2 * a->sign;
691  } else {
692  res = bf_cmpu(a, b);
693  if (a->sign)
694  res = -res;
695  }
696  return res;
697 }
698 
699 #define BF_CMP_EQ 1
700 #define BF_CMP_LT 2
701 #define BF_CMP_LE 3
702 
703 static int bf_cmp(const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, int op)
704 {
705  BOOL is_both_zero;
706  int res;
707 
708  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN || b->expn == BF_EXP_NAN)
709  return 0;
710  if (a->sign != b->sign) {
711  is_both_zero = (a->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO && b->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO);
712  if (is_both_zero) {
713  return op & BF_CMP_EQ;
714  } else if (op & BF_CMP_LT) {
715  return a->sign;
716  } else {
717  return FALSE;
718  }
719  } else {
720  res = bf_cmpu(a, b);
721  if (res == 0) {
722  return op & BF_CMP_EQ;
723  } else if (op & BF_CMP_LT) {
724  return (res < 0) ^ a->sign;
725  } else {
726  return FALSE;
727  }
728  }
729 }
730 
731 int bf_cmp_eq(const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
732 {
733  return bf_cmp(a, b, BF_CMP_EQ);
734 }
735 
736 int bf_cmp_le(const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
737 {
738  return bf_cmp(a, b, BF_CMP_LE);
739 }
740 
741 int bf_cmp_lt(const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
742 {
743  return bf_cmp(a, b, BF_CMP_LT);
744 }
745 
746 /* Compute the number of bits 'n' matching the pattern:
747  a= X1000..0
748  b= X0111..1
749 
750  When computing a-b, the result will have at least n leading zero
751  bits.
752 
753  Precondition: a > b and a.expn - b.expn = 0 or 1
754 */
755 static limb_t count_cancelled_bits(const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
756 {
757  slimb_t bit_offset, b_offset, n;
758  int p, p1;
759  limb_t v1, v2, mask;
760 
761  bit_offset = a->len * LIMB_BITS - 1;
762  b_offset = (b->len - a->len) * LIMB_BITS - (LIMB_BITS - 1) +
763  a->expn - b->expn;
764  n = 0;
765 
766  /* first search the equals bits */
767  for(;;) {
768  v1 = get_limbz(a, bit_offset >> LIMB_LOG2_BITS);
769  v2 = get_bits(b->tab, b->len, bit_offset + b_offset);
770  // printf("v1=" FMT_LIMB " v2=" FMT_LIMB "\n", v1, v2);
771  if (v1 != v2)
772  break;
773  n += LIMB_BITS;
774  bit_offset -= LIMB_BITS;
775  }
776  /* find the position of the first different bit */
777  p = clz(v1 ^ v2) + 1;
778  n += p;
779  /* then search for '0' in a and '1' in b */
780  p = LIMB_BITS - p;
781  if (p > 0) {
782  /* search in the trailing p bits of v1 and v2 */
783  mask = limb_mask(0, p - 1);
784  p1 = bf_min(clz(v1 & mask), clz((~v2) & mask)) - (LIMB_BITS - p);
785  n += p1;
786  if (p1 != p)
787  goto done;
788  }
789  bit_offset -= LIMB_BITS;
790  for(;;) {
791  v1 = get_limbz(a, bit_offset >> LIMB_LOG2_BITS);
792  v2 = get_bits(b->tab, b->len, bit_offset + b_offset);
793  // printf("v1=" FMT_LIMB " v2=" FMT_LIMB "\n", v1, v2);
794  if (v1 != 0 || v2 != -1) {
795  /* different: count the matching bits */
796  p1 = bf_min(clz(v1), clz(~v2));
797  n += p1;
798  break;
799  }
800  n += LIMB_BITS;
801  bit_offset -= LIMB_BITS;
802  }
803  done:
804  return n;
805 }
806 
807 static int bf_add_internal(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, limb_t prec,
808  bf_flags_t flags, int b_neg)
809 {
810  const bf_t *tmp;
811  int is_sub, ret, cmp_res, a_sign, b_sign;
812 
813  a_sign = a->sign;
814  b_sign = b->sign ^ b_neg;
815  is_sub = a_sign ^ b_sign;
816  cmp_res = bf_cmpu(a, b);
817  if (cmp_res < 0) {
818  tmp = a;
819  a = b;
820  b = tmp;
821  a_sign = b_sign; /* b_sign is never used later */
822  }
823  /* abs(a) >= abs(b) */
824  if (cmp_res == 0 && is_sub && a->expn < BF_EXP_INF) {
825  /* zero result */
826  bf_set_zero(r, (flags & BF_RND_MASK) == BF_RNDD);
827  ret = 0;
828  } else if (a->len == 0 || b->len == 0) {
829  ret = 0;
830  if (a->expn >= BF_EXP_INF) {
831  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
832  /* at least one operand is NaN */
833  bf_set_nan(r);
834  } else if (b->expn == BF_EXP_INF && is_sub) {
835  /* infinities with different signs */
836  bf_set_nan(r);
837  ret = BF_ST_INVALID_OP;
838  } else {
839  bf_set_inf(r, a_sign);
840  }
841  } else {
842  /* at least one zero and not subtract */
843  bf_set(r, a);
844  r->sign = a_sign;
845  goto renorm;
846  }
847  } else {
848  slimb_t d, a_offset, b_bit_offset, i, cancelled_bits;
849  limb_t carry, v1, v2, u, r_len, carry1, precl, tot_len, z, sub_mask;
850 
851  r->sign = a_sign;
852  r->expn = a->expn;
853  d = a->expn - b->expn;
854  /* must add more precision for the leading cancelled bits in
855  subtraction */
856  if (is_sub) {
857  if (d <= 1)
858  cancelled_bits = count_cancelled_bits(a, b);
859  else
860  cancelled_bits = 1;
861  } else {
862  cancelled_bits = 0;
863  }
864 
865  /* add two extra bits for rounding */
866  precl = (cancelled_bits + prec + 2 + LIMB_BITS - 1) / LIMB_BITS;
867  tot_len = bf_max(a->len, b->len + (d + LIMB_BITS - 1) / LIMB_BITS);
868  r_len = bf_min(precl, tot_len);
869  bf_resize(r, r_len);
870  a_offset = a->len - r_len;
871  b_bit_offset = (b->len - r_len) * LIMB_BITS + d;
872 
873  /* compute the bits before for the rounding */
874  carry = is_sub;
875  z = 0;
876  sub_mask = -is_sub;
877  i = r_len - tot_len;
878  while (i < 0) {
879  slimb_t ap, bp;
880  BOOL inflag;
881 
882  ap = a_offset + i;
883  bp = b_bit_offset + i * LIMB_BITS;
884  inflag = FALSE;
885  if (ap >= 0 && ap < a->len) {
886  v1 = a->tab[ap];
887  inflag = TRUE;
888  } else {
889  v1 = 0;
890  }
891  if (bp + LIMB_BITS > 0 && bp < (slimb_t)(b->len * LIMB_BITS)) {
892  v2 = get_bits(b->tab, b->len, bp);
893  inflag = TRUE;
894  } else {
895  v2 = 0;
896  }
897  if (!inflag) {
898  /* outside 'a' and 'b': go directly to the next value
899  inside a or b so that the running time does not
900  depend on the exponent difference */
901  i = 0;
902  if (ap < 0)
903  i = bf_min(i, -a_offset);
904  /* b_bit_offset + i * LIMB_BITS + LIMB_BITS >= 1
905  equivalent to
906  i >= ceil(-b_bit_offset + 1 - LIMB_BITS) / LIMB_BITS)
907  */
908  if (bp + LIMB_BITS <= 0)
909  i = bf_min(i, (-b_bit_offset) >> LIMB_LOG2_BITS);
910  } else {
911  i++;
912  }
913  v2 ^= sub_mask;
914  u = v1 + v2;
915  carry1 = u < v1;
916  u += carry;
917  carry = (u < carry) | carry1;
918  z |= u;
919  }
920  /* and the result */
921  for(i = 0; i < r_len; i++) {
922  v1 = get_limbz(a, a_offset + i);
923  v2 = get_bits(b->tab, b->len, b_bit_offset + i * LIMB_BITS);
924  v2 ^= sub_mask;
925  u = v1 + v2;
926  carry1 = u < v1;
927  u += carry;
928  carry = (u < carry) | carry1;
929  r->tab[i] = u;
930  }
931  /* set the extra bits for the rounding */
932  r->tab[0] |= (z != 0);
933 
934  /* carry is only possible in add case */
935  if (!is_sub && carry) {
936  bf_resize(r, r_len + 1);
937  r->tab[r_len] = 1;
938  r->expn += LIMB_BITS;
939  }
940  renorm:
941  ret = bf_normalize_and_round(r, prec, flags);
942  }
943  return ret;
944 }
945 
946 static int __bf_add(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, limb_t prec,
947  bf_flags_t flags)
948 {
949  return bf_add_internal(r, a, b, prec, flags, 0);
950 }
951 
952 static int __bf_sub(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, limb_t prec,
953  bf_flags_t flags)
954 {
955  return bf_add_internal(r, a, b, prec, flags, 1);
956 }
957 
958 static limb_t mp_add(limb_t *res, const limb_t *op1, const limb_t *op2,
959  limb_t n, limb_t carry)
960 {
961  slimb_t i;
962  limb_t k, a, v, k1;
963 
964  k = carry;
965  for(i=0;i<n;i++) {
966  v = op1[i];
967  a = v + op2[i];
968  k1 = a < v;
969  a = a + k;
970  k = (a < k) | k1;
971  res[i] = a;
972  }
973  return k;
974 }
975 
976 /* tabr[] += taba[] * b, return the high word. */
977 static limb_t mp_add_mul1(limb_t *tabr, const limb_t *taba, limb_t n,
978  limb_t b)
979 {
980  limb_t i, l;
981  dlimb_t t;
982 
983  l = 0;
984  for(i = 0; i < n; i++) {
985  t = (dlimb_t)taba[i] * (dlimb_t)b + l + tabr[i];
986  tabr[i] = t;
987  l = t >> LIMB_BITS;
988  }
989  return l;
990 }
991 
992 /* tabr[] -= taba[] * b. Return the value to substract to the high
993  word. */
994 static limb_t mp_sub_mul1(limb_t *tabr, const limb_t *taba, limb_t n,
995  limb_t b)
996 {
997  limb_t i, l;
998  dlimb_t t;
999 
1000  l = 0;
1001  for(i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1002  t = tabr[i] - (dlimb_t)taba[i] * (dlimb_t)b - l;
1003  tabr[i] = t;
1004  l = -(t >> LIMB_BITS);
1005  }
1006  return l;
1007 }
1008 
1009 /* WARNING: d must be >= 2^(LIMB_BITS-1) */
1010 static inline limb_t udiv1norm_init(limb_t d)
1011 {
1012  limb_t a0, a1;
1013  a1 = -d - 1;
1014  a0 = -1;
1015  return (((dlimb_t)a1 << LIMB_BITS) | a0) / d;
1016 }
1017 
1018 /* return the quotient and the remainder in '*pr'of 'a1*2^LIMB_BITS+a0
1019  / d' with 0 <= a1 < d. */
1020 static inline limb_t udiv1norm(limb_t *pr, limb_t a1, limb_t a0,
1021  limb_t d, limb_t d_inv)
1022 {
1023  limb_t n1m, n_adj, q, r, ah;
1024  dlimb_t a;
1025  n1m = ((slimb_t)a0 >> (LIMB_BITS - 1));
1026  n_adj = a0 + (n1m & d);
1027  a = (dlimb_t)d_inv * (a1 - n1m) + n_adj;
1028  q = (a >> LIMB_BITS) + a1;
1029  /* compute a - q * r and update q so that the remainder is\
1030  between 0 and d - 1 */
1031  a = ((dlimb_t)a1 << LIMB_BITS) | a0;
1032  a = a - (dlimb_t)q * d - d;
1033  ah = a >> LIMB_BITS;
1034  q += 1 + ah;
1035  r = (limb_t)a + (ah & d);
1036  *pr = r;
1037  return q;
1038 }
1039 
1040 /* b must be >= 1 << (LIMB_BITS - 1) */
1041 static limb_t mp_div1norm(limb_t *tabr, const limb_t *taba, limb_t n,
1042  limb_t b, limb_t r)
1043 {
1044  slimb_t i;
1045 
1046  if (n >= 3) {
1047  limb_t b_inv;
1048  b_inv = udiv1norm_init(b);
1049  for(i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1050  tabr[i] = udiv1norm(&r, r, taba[i], b, b_inv);
1051  }
1052  } else {
1053  dlimb_t a1;
1054  for(i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1055  a1 = ((dlimb_t)r << LIMB_BITS) | taba[i];
1056  tabr[i] = a1 / b;
1057  r = a1 % b;
1058  }
1059  }
1060  return r;
1061 }
1062 
1063 /* base case division: divides taba[0..na-1] by tabb[0..nb-1]. tabb[nb
1064  - 1] must be >= 1 << (LIMB_BITS - 1). na - nb must be >= 0. 'taba'
1065  is modified and contains the remainder (nb limbs). tabq[0..na-nb]
1066  contains the quotient. taba[na] is modified. */
1067 static void mp_divnorm(limb_t *tabq,
1068  limb_t *taba, limb_t na,
1069  const limb_t *tabb, limb_t nb)
1070 {
1071  limb_t r, a, c, q, v, b1, b1_inv, n, dummy_r;
1072  slimb_t i;
1073 
1074  b1 = tabb[nb - 1];
1075  if (nb == 1) {
1076  taba[0] = mp_div1norm(tabq, taba, na, b1, 0);
1077  return;
1078  }
1079  taba[na] = 0;
1080  n = na - nb;
1081  if (n >= 3)
1082  b1_inv = udiv1norm_init(b1);
1083  else
1084  b1_inv = 0;
1085 
1086  /* XXX: could simplify the first iteration */
1087  for(i = n; i >= 0; i--) {
1088  if (unlikely(taba[i + nb] >= b1)) {
1089  q = -1;
1090  } else if (b1_inv) {
1091  q = udiv1norm(&dummy_r, taba[i + nb], taba[i + nb - 1], b1, b1_inv);
1092  } else {
1093  dlimb_t al;
1094  al = ((dlimb_t)taba[i + nb] << LIMB_BITS) | taba[i + nb - 1];
1095  q = al / b1;
1096  r = al % b1;
1097  }
1098  r = mp_sub_mul1(taba + i, tabb, nb, q);
1099 
1100  v = taba[i + nb];
1101  a = v - r;
1102  c = (a > v);
1103  taba[i + nb] = a;
1104 
1105  if (c != 0) {
1106  /* negative result */
1107  for(;;) {
1108  q--;
1109  c = mp_add(taba + i, taba + i, tabb, nb, 0);
1110  /* propagate carry and test if positive result */
1111  if (c != 0) {
1112  if (++taba[i + nb] == 0) {
1113  break;
1114  }
1115  }
1116  }
1117  }
1118  tabq[i] = q;
1119  }
1120 }
1121 
1122 int bf_mul(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, limb_t prec,
1123  bf_flags_t flags)
1124 {
1125  limb_t i;
1126  int ret, r_sign;
1127 
1128  if (a->len < b->len) {
1129  const bf_t *tmp = a;
1130  a = b;
1131  b = tmp;
1132  }
1133  r_sign = a->sign ^ b->sign;
1134  /* here b->len <= a->len */
1135  if (b->len == 0) {
1136  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN || b->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
1137  bf_set_nan(r);
1138  ret = 0;
1139  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF || b->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
1140  if ((a->expn == BF_EXP_INF && b->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO) ||
1141  (a->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO && b->expn == BF_EXP_INF)) {
1142  bf_set_nan(r);
1143  ret = BF_ST_INVALID_OP;
1144  } else {
1145  bf_set_inf(r, r_sign);
1146  ret = 0;
1147  }
1148  } else {
1149  bf_set_zero(r, r_sign);
1150  ret = 0;
1151  }
1152  } else {
1153  bf_t tmp, *r1 = NULL;
1154  limb_t a_len, b_len, precl;
1155  limb_t *a_tab, *b_tab;
1156 
1157  a_len = a->len;
1158  b_len = b->len;
1159 
1160  if ((flags & BF_RND_MASK) == BF_RNDF) {
1161  /* faithful rounding does not require using the full inputs */
1162  precl = (prec + 2 + LIMB_BITS - 1) / LIMB_BITS;
1163  a_len = bf_min(a_len, precl);
1164  b_len = bf_min(b_len, precl);
1165  }
1166  a_tab = a->tab + a->len - a_len;
1167  b_tab = b->tab + b->len - b_len;
1168 
1169 #ifdef USE_FFT_MUL
1170  if (b_len >= FFT_MUL_THRESHOLD) {
1171  int mul_flags = 0;
1172  if (r == a)
1173  mul_flags |= FFT_MUL_R_OVERLAP_A;
1174  if (r == b)
1175  mul_flags |= FFT_MUL_R_OVERLAP_B;
1176  fft_mul(r, a_tab, a_len, b_tab, b_len, mul_flags);
1177  } else
1178 #endif
1179  {
1180  if (r == a || r == b) {
1181  bf_init(r->ctx, &tmp);
1182  r1 = r;
1183  r = &tmp;
1184  }
1185  bf_resize(r, a_len + b_len);
1186  memset(r->tab, 0, sizeof(limb_t) * a_len);
1187  for(i = 0; i < b_len; i++) {
1188  r->tab[i + a_len] = mp_add_mul1(r->tab + i, a_tab, a_len,
1189  b_tab[i]);
1190  }
1191  }
1192  r->sign = r_sign;
1193  r->expn = a->expn + b->expn;
1194  ret = bf_normalize_and_round(r, prec, flags);
1195  if (r == &tmp)
1196  bf_move(r1, &tmp);
1197  }
1198  return ret;
1199 }
1200 
1201 /* multiply 'r' by 2^e */
1202 int bf_mul_2exp(bf_t *r, slimb_t e, limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags)
1203 {
1204  slimb_t e_max;
1205  if (r->len == 0)
1206  return 0;
1207  e_max = ((limb_t)1 << BF_EXP_BITS_MAX) - 1;
1208  e = bf_max(e, -e_max);
1209  e = bf_min(e, e_max);
1210  r->expn += e;
1211  return __bf_round(r, prec, flags, r->len);
1212 }
1213 
1214 static void bf_recip_rec(bf_t *a, const bf_t *x, limb_t prec1)
1215 {
1216  bf_t t0;
1217  limb_t prec;
1218 
1219  bf_init(a->ctx, &t0);
1220 
1221  if (prec1 <= LIMB_BITS - 3) {
1222  limb_t v;
1223  /* initial approximation */
1224  v = x->tab[x->len - 1];
1225  /* 2^(L-1) <= v <= 2^L-1 (L=LIMB_BITS) */
1226  v = ((dlimb_t)1 << (2 * LIMB_BITS - 2)) / v;
1227  /* 2^(L-2) <= v <= 2^(L-1) */
1228  bf_resize(a, 1);
1229  a->sign = x->sign;
1230  a->expn = 2 - x->expn;
1231  if (v == ((limb_t)1 << (LIMB_BITS - 1))) {
1232  a->tab[0] = v;
1233  } else {
1234  a->tab[0] = v << 1;
1235  a->expn--;
1236  }
1237  a->tab[0] &= limb_mask(LIMB_BITS - prec1, LIMB_BITS - 1);
1238  } else {
1239  /* XXX: prove the added precision */
1240  bf_recip_rec(a, x, (prec1 / 2) + 8);
1241  prec = prec1 + 8;
1242 
1243  /* a = a + a * (1 - x * a) */
1244  bf_mul(&t0, x, a, prec, BF_RNDF);
1245  t0.sign ^= 1;
1246  bf_add_si(&t0, &t0, 1, prec, BF_RNDF);
1247  bf_mul(&t0, &t0, a, prec, BF_RNDF);
1248  bf_add(a, a, &t0, prec1, BF_RNDF);
1249  }
1250  // bf_print_str("r", a);
1251  bf_delete(&t0);
1252 }
1253 
1254 /* Note: only faithful rounding is supported */
1255 void bf_recip(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, limb_t prec)
1256 {
1257  assert(r != a);
1258  if (a->len == 0) {
1259  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
1260  bf_set_nan(r);
1261  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
1262  bf_set_zero(r, a->sign);
1263  } else {
1264  bf_set_inf(r, a->sign);
1265  }
1266  } else {
1267  // bf_print_str("a", a);
1268  bf_recip_rec(r, a, prec);
1269  }
1270 }
1271 
1272 /* add zero limbs if necessary to have at least precl limbs */
1273 static void bf_add_zero_limbs(bf_t *r, limb_t precl)
1274 {
1275  limb_t l = r->len;
1276  if (l < precl) {
1277  bf_resize(r, precl);
1278  memmove(r->tab + precl - l, r->tab,
1279  l * sizeof(limb_t));
1280  memset(r->tab, 0, (precl - l) * sizeof(limb_t));
1281  }
1282 }
1283 
1284 /* set a bit to 1 at bit position >= (precl * LIMB_BITS - 1) */
1285 static void bf_or_one(bf_t *r, limb_t precl)
1286 {
1287  bf_add_zero_limbs(r, precl);
1288  r->tab[0] |= 1;
1289 }
1290 
1291 /* Return e such as a=m*2^e with m odd integer. return 0 if a is zero,
1292  Infinite or Nan. */
1293 slimb_t bf_get_exp_min(const bf_t *a)
1294 {
1295  slimb_t i;
1296  limb_t v;
1297  int k;
1298 
1299  for(i = 0; i < a->len; i++) {
1300  v = a->tab[i];
1301  if (v != 0) {
1302  k = ctz(v);
1303  return a->expn - (a->len - i) * LIMB_BITS + k;
1304  }
1305  }
1306  return 0;
1307 }
1308 
1309 /* a and b must be finite numbers with a >= 0 and b > 0. 'q' is the
1310  integer defined as floor(a/b) and r = a - q * b. */
1311 static void bf_tdivremu(bf_t *q, bf_t *r,
1312  const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
1313 {
1314  if (a->expn < b->expn) {
1315  bf_set_ui(q, 0);
1316  bf_set(r, a);
1317  } else {
1318  /* for large numbers, use the floating point division in
1319  faithful mode */
1320  bf_div(q, a, b, bf_max(a->expn - b->expn + 1, 2), BF_RNDF);
1321  bf_rint(q, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1322  bf_mul(r, q, b, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDN);
1323  bf_sub(r, a, r, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDN);
1324  if (r->len != 0 && r->sign) {
1325  bf_add_si(q, q, -1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1326  bf_add(r, r, b, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1327  }
1328  }
1329 }
1330 
1331 static int __bf_div(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, limb_t prec,
1332  bf_flags_t flags)
1333 {
1334  int ret, r_sign;
1335  limb_t n, nb, precl;
1336 
1337  r_sign = a->sign ^ b->sign;
1338  if (a->expn >= BF_EXP_INF || b->expn >= BF_EXP_INF) {
1339  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN || b->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
1340  bf_set_nan(r);
1341  return 0;
1342  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF && b->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
1343  bf_set_nan(r);
1344  return BF_ST_INVALID_OP;
1345  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
1346  bf_set_inf(r, r_sign);
1347  return 0;
1348  } else {
1349  bf_set_zero(r, r_sign);
1350  return 0;
1351  }
1352  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO) {
1353  if (b->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO) {
1354  bf_set_nan(r);
1355  return BF_ST_INVALID_OP;
1356  } else {
1357  bf_set_zero(r, r_sign);
1358  return 0;
1359  }
1360  } else if (b->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO) {
1361  bf_set_inf(r, r_sign);
1362  return BF_ST_DIVIDE_ZERO;
1363  }
1364 
1365  /* number of limbs of the quotient (2 extra bits for rounding) */
1366  precl = (prec + 2 + LIMB_BITS - 1) / LIMB_BITS;
1367  nb = b->len;
1368  n = bf_max(a->len, precl);
1369 
1370  if (nb <= BASECASE_DIV_THRESHOLD_B ||
1371  (slimb_t)n <= (BASECASE_DIV_THRESHOLD_Q - 1)) {
1372  limb_t *taba, na, i;
1373  slimb_t d;
1374 
1375  na = n + nb;
1376  taba = bf_malloc(r->ctx, (na + 1) * sizeof(limb_t));
1377  d = na - a->len;
1378  memset(taba, 0, d * sizeof(limb_t));
1379  memcpy(taba + d, a->tab, a->len * sizeof(limb_t));
1380  bf_resize(r, n + 1);
1381  mp_divnorm(r->tab, taba, na, b->tab, nb);
1382 
1383  /* see if non zero remainder */
1384  for(i = 0; i < nb; i++) {
1385  if (taba[i] != 0) {
1386  r->tab[0] |= 1;
1387  break;
1388  }
1389  }
1390  bf_free(r->ctx, taba);
1391  r->expn = a->expn - b->expn + LIMB_BITS;
1392  r->sign = r_sign;
1393  ret = bf_normalize_and_round(r, prec, flags);
1394  } else if ((flags & BF_RND_MASK) == BF_RNDF) {
1395  bf_t b_inv;
1396  bf_init(r->ctx, &b_inv);
1397  bf_recip(&b_inv, b, prec + 3);
1398  ret = bf_mul(r, a, &b_inv, prec, flags);
1399  bf_delete(&b_inv);
1400  } else {
1401  bf_t a1_s, *a1 = &a1_s;
1402  bf_t b1_s, *b1 = &b1_s;
1403  bf_t rem_s, *rem = &rem_s;
1404 
1405  /* convert the mantissa of 'a' and 'b' to integers and generate
1406  a quotient with at least prec + 2 bits */
1407  a1->expn = (n + nb) * LIMB_BITS;
1408  a1->tab = a->tab;
1409  a1->len = a->len;
1410  a1->sign = 0;
1411 
1412  b1->expn = nb * LIMB_BITS;
1413  b1->tab = b->tab;
1414  b1->len = nb;
1415  b1->sign = 0;
1416 
1417  bf_init(r->ctx, rem);
1418  bf_tdivremu(r, rem, a1, b1);
1419  /* the remainder is not zero: put it in the rounding bits */
1420  if (rem->len != 0) {
1421  bf_or_one(r, precl);
1422  }
1423  bf_delete(rem);
1424  r->expn += a->expn - b->expn - n * LIMB_BITS;
1425  r->sign = r_sign;
1426  ret = bf_round(r, prec, flags);
1427  }
1428  return ret;
1429 }
1430 
1431 /* division and remainder.
1432 
1433  rnd_mode is the rounding mode for the quotient. The additional
1434  rounding mode BF_RND_EUCLIDIAN is supported.
1435 
1436  'q' is an integer. 'r' is rounded with prec and flags (prec can be
1437  BF_PREC_INF).
1438 */
1439 int bf_divrem(bf_t *q, bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b,
1440  limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags, int rnd_mode)
1441 {
1442  bf_t a1_s, *a1 = &a1_s;
1443  bf_t b1_s, *b1 = &b1_s;
1444  int q_sign;
1445  BOOL is_ceil, is_rndn;
1446 
1447  assert(q != a && q != b);
1448  assert(r != a && r != b);
1449  assert(q != r);
1450 
1451  if (a->len == 0 || b->len == 0) {
1452  bf_set_zero(q, 0);
1453  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN || b->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
1454  bf_set_nan(r);
1455  return 0;
1456  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF || b->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO) {
1457  bf_set_nan(r);
1458  return BF_ST_INVALID_OP;
1459  } else {
1460  bf_set(r, a);
1461  return bf_round(r, prec, flags);
1462  }
1463  }
1464 
1465  q_sign = a->sign ^ b->sign;
1466  is_rndn = (rnd_mode == BF_RNDN || rnd_mode == BF_RNDNA ||
1467  rnd_mode == BF_RNDNU);
1468  switch(rnd_mode) {
1469  default:
1470  case BF_RNDZ:
1471  case BF_RNDN:
1472  case BF_RNDNA:
1473  is_ceil = FALSE;
1474  break;
1475  case BF_RNDD:
1476  is_ceil = q_sign;
1477  break;
1478  case BF_RNDU:
1479  is_ceil = q_sign ^ 1;
1480  break;
1481  case BF_DIVREM_EUCLIDIAN:
1482  is_ceil = a->sign;
1483  break;
1484  case BF_RNDNU:
1485  /* XXX: unsupported yet */
1486  abort();
1487  }
1488 
1489  a1->expn = a->expn;
1490  a1->tab = a->tab;
1491  a1->len = a->len;
1492  a1->sign = 0;
1493 
1494  b1->expn = b->expn;
1495  b1->tab = b->tab;
1496  b1->len = b->len;
1497  b1->sign = 0;
1498 
1499  /* XXX: could improve to avoid having a large 'q' */
1500  bf_tdivremu(q, r, a1, b1);
1501 
1502  if (r->len != 0) {
1503  if (is_rndn) {
1504  int res;
1505  b1->expn--;
1506  res = bf_cmpu(r, b1);
1507  b1->expn++;
1508  if (res > 0 ||
1509  (res == 0 &&
1510  (rnd_mode == BF_RNDNA ||
1511  get_bit(q->tab, q->len, q->len * LIMB_BITS - q->expn)))) {
1512  goto do_sub_r;
1513  }
1514  } else if (is_ceil) {
1515  do_sub_r:
1516  bf_add_si(q, q, 1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1517  bf_sub(r, r, b1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1518  }
1519  }
1520 
1521  r->sign ^= a->sign;
1522  q->sign = q_sign;
1523  return bf_round(r, prec, flags);
1524 }
1525 
1526 int bf_fmod(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, limb_t prec,
1527  bf_flags_t flags)
1528 {
1529  bf_t q_s, *q = &q_s;
1530  int ret;
1531 
1532  bf_init(r->ctx, q);
1533  ret = bf_divrem(q, r, a, b, prec, flags, BF_RNDZ);
1534  bf_delete(q);
1535  return ret;
1536 }
1537 
1538 int bf_remainder(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, limb_t prec,
1539  bf_flags_t flags)
1540 {
1541  bf_t q_s, *q = &q_s;
1542  int ret;
1543 
1544  bf_init(r->ctx, q);
1545  ret = bf_divrem(q, r, a, b, prec, flags, BF_RNDN);
1546  bf_delete(q);
1547  return ret;
1548 }

1551 {
1552 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
1553  return bf_get_int32(pres, a, flags);
1554 #else
1555  return bf_get_int64(pres, a, flags);
1556 #endif
1557 }

1572 static __maybe_unused inline limb_t mul_mod(limb_t a, limb_t b, limb_t m)
1573 {
1574  dlimb_t t;
1575  t = (dlimb_t)a * (dlimb_t)b;
1576  return t % m;
1577 }
1578 
1579 #if defined(USE_MUL_CHECK)
1580 static limb_t mp_mod1(const limb_t *tab, limb_t n, limb_t m, limb_t r)
1581 {
1582  slimb_t i;
1583  dlimb_t t;
1584 
1585  for(i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1586  t = ((dlimb_t)r << LIMB_BITS) | tab[i];
1587  r = t % m;
1588  }
1589  return r;
1590 }
1591 #endif

1593 /* (128.0 / sqrt((i + 64) / 256)) & 0xff */
1594 static const uint8_t rsqrt_table[192] = {
1595  0,254,252,250,248,247,245,243,241,240,238,236,235,233,232,230,
1596 229,228,226,225,223,222,221,220,218,217,216,215,214,212,211,210,
1597 209,208,207,206,205,204,203,202,201,200,199,198,197,196,195,194,
1598 194,193,192,191,190,189,189,188,187,186,185,185,184,183,182,182,
1599 181,180,180,179,178,178,177,176,176,175,174,174,173,172,172,171,
1600 171,170,169,169,168,168,167,167,166,166,165,164,164,163,163,162,
1601 162,161,161,160,160,159,159,158,158,158,157,157,156,156,155,155,
1602 154,154,154,153,153,152,152,151,151,151,150,150,149,149,149,148,
1603 148,147,147,147,146,146,146,145,145,144,144,144,143,143,143,142,
1604 142,142,141,141,141,140,140,140,139,139,139,138,138,138,137,137,
1605 137,137,136,136,136,135,135,135,134,134,134,134,133,133,133,132,
1606 132,132,132,131,131,131,131,130,130,130,130,129,129,129,129,128,
1607 };
1608 
1609 static void __bf_rsqrt(bf_t *a, const bf_t *x, limb_t prec1)
1610 {
1611  bf_t t0;
1612  limb_t prec;
1613 
1614  if (prec1 <= 7) {
1615  slimb_t e;
1616  limb_t v;
1617  /* initial approximation using 8 mantissa bits */
1618  v = x->tab[x->len - 1];
1619  e = x->expn;
1620  if (e & 1) {
1621  v >>= 1;
1622  e++;
1623  }
1624  v = rsqrt_table[(v >> (LIMB_BITS - 8)) - 64];
1625  e = 1 - (e / 2);
1626  if (v == 0) {
1627  v = 128; /* real table value is 256 */
1628  e++;
1629  }
1630  bf_resize(a, 1);
1631  a->tab[0] = (v << (LIMB_BITS - 8)) &
1632  limb_mask(LIMB_BITS - prec1, LIMB_BITS - 1);
1633  a->expn = e;
1634  a->sign = 0;
1635  } else {
1636  /* XXX: prove rounding */
1637  __bf_rsqrt(a, x, (prec1 / 2) + 2);
1638 
1639  prec = prec1 + 3;
1640 
1641  /* x' = x + (x/2) * (1 - a * x^2) */
1642  bf_init(a->ctx, &t0);
1643 
1644  bf_mul(&t0, a, a, prec, BF_RNDF);
1645  bf_mul(&t0, &t0, x, prec, BF_RNDF);
1646  t0.sign ^= 1;
1647  bf_add_si(&t0, &t0, 1, prec, BF_RNDF);
1648  bf_mul(&t0, &t0, a, prec, BF_RNDF);
1649  if (t0.len != 0)
1650  t0.expn--;
1651  bf_add(a, a, &t0, prec1, BF_RNDF);
1652 
1653  bf_delete(&t0);
1654  }
1655 }
1656 
1657 static int __bf_sqrt(bf_t *x, const bf_t *a, limb_t prec1, bf_flags_t flags)
1658 {
1659  bf_t t0, t1;
1660  limb_t prec;
1661  int ret;
1662 
1663  /* XXX: prove rounding */
1664  __bf_rsqrt(x, a, (prec1 / 2) + 2);
1665  prec = prec1 + 3;
1666 
1667  /* x' = a * x + (x/2) * (a - (a * x)^2) */
1668 
1669  bf_init(x->ctx, &t0);
1670  bf_init(x->ctx, &t1);
1671  bf_mul(&t1, x, a, prec, BF_RNDF);
1672  bf_mul(&t0, &t1, &t1, prec, BF_RNDF);
1673  t0.sign ^= 1;
1674  bf_add(&t0, &t0, a, prec, BF_RNDF);
1675  bf_mul(&t0, &t0, x, prec, BF_RNDF);
1676  if (t0.len != 0)
1677  t0.expn--;
1678  ret = bf_add(x, &t1, &t0, prec1, flags);
1679 
1680  bf_delete(&t0);
1681  bf_delete(&t1);
1682  return ret;
1683 }
1684 
1685 /* Note: only faithful rounding is supported */
1686 void bf_rsqrt(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, limb_t prec)
1687 {
1688  if (a->len == 0) {
1689  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN ||
1690  (a->sign && a->expn != BF_EXP_ZERO)) {
1691  bf_set_nan(r);
1692  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
1693  bf_set_zero(r, a->sign);
1694  } else {
1695  bf_set_inf(r, 0);
1696  }
1697  } else if (a->sign) {
1698  bf_set_nan(r);
1699  } else {
1700  // bf_print_str("a", a);
1701  __bf_rsqrt(r, a, prec);
1702  }
1703 }
1704 
1705 /* return floor(sqrt(a)) */
1706 static limb_t bf_isqrt(limb_t a)
1707 {
1708  unsigned int l;
1709  limb_t u, s;
1710 
1711  if (a == 0)
1712  return 0;
1713  l = ceil_log2(a);
1714  u = (limb_t)1 << ((l + 1) / 2);
1715  /* u >= floor(sqrt(a)) */
1716  for(;;) {
1717  s = u;
1718  u = ((a / s) + s) / 2;
1719  if (u >= s)
1720  break;
1721  }
1722  return s;
1723 }
1724 
1725 /* Integer square root with remainder. 'a' must be an integer. r =
1726  floor(sqrt(a)) and rem = a - r^2. BF_ST_INEXACT is set if the result
1727  is inexact. 'rem' can be NULL if the remainder is not needed. */
1728 int bf_sqrtrem(bf_t *r, bf_t *rem1, const bf_t *a)
1729 {
1730  int ret;
1731 
1732  if (a->len == 0) {
1733  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
1734  bf_set_nan(r);
1735  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF && a->sign) {
1736  goto invalid_op;
1737  } else {
1738  bf_set(r, a);
1739  }
1740  if (rem1)
1741  bf_set_ui(rem1, 0);
1742  ret = 0;
1743  } else if (a->sign) {
1744  invalid_op:
1745  bf_set_nan(r);
1746  if (rem1)
1747  bf_set_ui(rem1, 0);
1748  ret = BF_ST_INVALID_OP;
1749  } else {
1750  bf_t rem_s, *rem;
1751  int res;
1752 
1753  bf_sqrt(r, a, (a->expn + 1) / 2, BF_RNDF);
1754  bf_rint(r, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1755  /* see if the result is exact by computing the remainder */
1756  if (rem1) {
1757  rem = rem1;
1758  } else {
1759  rem = &rem_s;
1760  bf_init(r->ctx, rem);
1761  }
1762  bf_mul(rem, r, r, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1763  ret = 0;
1764  if (rem1) {
1765  bf_neg(rem);
1766  bf_add(rem, rem, a, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1767  if (rem->len != 0) {
1768  ret = BF_ST_INEXACT;
1769  if (rem->sign) {
1770  bf_t a1_s, *a1 = &a1_s;
1771  bf_add_si(r, r, -1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1772  a1->tab = a->tab;
1773  a1->len = a->len;
1774  a1->sign = a->sign;
1775  a1->expn = a->expn + 1;
1776  bf_add(rem, rem, r, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1777  bf_add_si(rem, rem, 1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1778  }
1779  } else {
1780  ret = 0;
1781  }
1782  } else {
1783  res = bf_cmpu(rem, a);
1784  bf_delete(rem);
1785  // printf("res2=%d\n", res2);
1786  if (res > 0) {
1787  /* need to correct the result */
1788  bf_add_si(r, r, -1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1789  }
1790  ret = (res != 0 ? BF_ST_INEXACT : 0);
1791  }
1792  }
1793  return ret;
1794 }
1795 
1796 int bf_sqrt(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags)
1797 {
1798  int rnd_mode, ret;
1799 
1800  assert(r != a);
1801 
1802  if (a->len == 0) {
1803  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
1804  bf_set_nan(r);
1805  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF && a->sign) {
1806  goto invalid_op;
1807  } else {
1808  bf_set(r, a);
1809  }
1810  ret = 0;
1811  } else if (a->sign) {
1812  invalid_op:
1813  bf_set_nan(r);
1814  ret = BF_ST_INVALID_OP;
1815  } else {
1816  rnd_mode = flags & BF_RND_MASK;
1817  if (rnd_mode == BF_RNDF) {
1818  ret = __bf_sqrt(r, a, prec, flags);
1819  } else {
1820  bf_t a1_s, *a1 = &a1_s;
1821  slimb_t d, prec2;
1822  int res1, res2;
1823 
1824  bf_init(r->ctx, a1);
1825  bf_set(a1, a);
1826  /* convert the mantissa to an integer with at most 2 *
1827  prec + 4 bits */
1828  prec2 = prec + 2;
1829  /* make '-a->expn + d' divisible by two */
1830  d = prec2 * 2 - (a->expn & 1);
1831  a1->expn = d;
1832  res1 = bf_rint(a1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
1833  res2 = bf_sqrtrem(r, NULL, a1);
1834  bf_delete(a1);
1835  if ((res2 | res1) != 0) {
1836  bf_or_one(r, (prec2 + LIMB_BITS - 1) / LIMB_BITS);
1837  }
1838  /* update the exponent */
1839  r->expn -= (-a->expn + d) >> 1;
1840  ret = bf_round(r, prec, flags);
1841  }
1842  }
1843  return ret;
1844 }
1845 
1846 static no_inline int bf_op2(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b, limb_t prec,
1847  bf_flags_t flags, bf_op2_func_t *func)
1848 {
1849  bf_t tmp;
1850  int ret;
1851 
1852  if (r == a || r == b) {
1853  bf_init(r->ctx, &tmp);
1854  ret = func(&tmp, a, b, prec, flags);
1855  bf_move(r, &tmp);
1856  } else {
1857  ret = func(r, a, b, prec, flags);
1858  }
1859  return ret;
1860 }

1863  bf_flags_t flags)
1864 {

1917 int bf_pow_ui(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, limb_t b, limb_t prec,
1918  bf_flags_t flags)
1919 {
1920  int ret, n_bits, i;
1921 
1922  assert(r != a);
1923  if (b == 0) {
1924  bf_set_ui(r, 1);
1925  return 0;
1926  }
1927  bf_set(r, a);
1928  ret = 0;
1929  n_bits = LIMB_BITS - clz(b);
1930  for(i = n_bits - 2; i >= 0; i--) {
1931  ret |= bf_mul(r, r, r, prec, flags);
1932  if ((b >> i) & 1)
1933  ret |= bf_mul(r, r, a, prec, flags);
1934  }
1935  return ret;
1936 }

1944  bf_set_ui(&a, a1);
1945  ret = bf_pow_ui(r, &a, b, prec, flags);
1946  bf_delete(&a);

1950 /* convert to integer (single rounding) */
1951 int bf_rint(bf_t *r, limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags)
1952 {
1953  int ret;
1954  if (r->len == 0)
1955  return 0;
1956  if (r->expn <= 0) {
1957  ret = __bf_round(r, r->expn, flags & ~BF_FLAG_SUBNORMAL, r->len) &
1958  ~BF_ST_UNDERFLOW;
1959  } else {
1960  ret = __bf_round(r, bf_min(r->expn, prec), flags, r->len);
1961  }
1962  return ret;
1963 }
1964 
1965 /* logical operations */
1966 #define BF_LOGIC_OR 0
1967 #define BF_LOGIC_XOR 1
1968 #define BF_LOGIC_AND 2
1969 
1970 static inline limb_t bf_logic_op1(limb_t a, limb_t b, int op)
1971 {
1972  switch(op) {
1973  case BF_LOGIC_OR:
1974  return a | b;
1975  case BF_LOGIC_XOR:
1976  return a ^ b;
1977  default:
1978  case BF_LOGIC_AND:
1979  return a & b;
1980  }
1981 }
1982 
1983 static void bf_logic_op(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a1, const bf_t *b1, int op)
1984 {
1985  bf_t b1_s, a1_s, *a, *b;
1986  limb_t a_sign, b_sign, r_sign;
1987  slimb_t l, i, a_bit_offset, b_bit_offset;
1988  limb_t v1, v2, v1_mask, v2_mask, r_mask;
1989 
1990  assert(r != a1 && r != b1);
1991 
1992  if (a1->expn <= 0)
1993  a_sign = 0; /* minus zero is considered as positive */
1994  else
1995  a_sign = a1->sign;
1996 
1997  if (b1->expn <= 0)
1998  b_sign = 0; /* minus zero is considered as positive */
1999  else
2000  b_sign = b1->sign;
2001 
2002  if (a_sign) {
2003  a = &a1_s;
2004  bf_init(r->ctx, a);
2005  bf_add_si(a, a1, 1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
2006  } else {
2007  a = (bf_t *)a1;
2008  }
2009 
2010  if (b_sign) {
2011  b = &b1_s;
2012  bf_init(r->ctx, b);
2013  bf_add_si(b, b1, 1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
2014  } else {
2015  b = (bf_t *)b1;
2016  }
2017 
2018  r_sign = bf_logic_op1(a_sign, b_sign, op);
2019  if (op == BF_LOGIC_AND && r_sign == 0) {
2020  /* no need to compute extra zeros for and */
2021  if (a_sign == 0 && b_sign == 0)
2022  l = bf_min(a->expn, b->expn);
2023  else if (a_sign == 0)
2024  l = a->expn;
2025  else
2026  l = b->expn;
2027  } else {
2028  l = bf_max(a->expn, b->expn);
2029  }
2030  /* Note: a or b can be zero */
2031  l = (bf_max(l, 1) + LIMB_BITS - 1) / LIMB_BITS;
2032  bf_resize(r, l);
2033  a_bit_offset = a->len * LIMB_BITS - a->expn;
2034  b_bit_offset = b->len * LIMB_BITS - b->expn;
2035  v1_mask = -a_sign;
2036  v2_mask = -b_sign;
2037  r_mask = -r_sign;
2038  for(i = 0; i < l; i++) {
2039  v1 = get_bits(a->tab, a->len, a_bit_offset + i * LIMB_BITS) ^ v1_mask;
2040  v2 = get_bits(b->tab, b->len, b_bit_offset + i * LIMB_BITS) ^ v2_mask;
2041  r->tab[i] = bf_logic_op1(v1, v2, op) ^ r_mask;
2042  }
2043  r->expn = l * LIMB_BITS;
2044  r->sign = r_sign;
2045  bf_normalize_and_round(r, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
2046  if (r_sign)
2047  bf_add_si(r, r, -1, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
2048  if (a == &a1_s)
2049  bf_delete(a);
2050  if (b == &b1_s)
2051  bf_delete(b);
2052 }
2053 
2054 /* 'a' and 'b' must be integers */
2055 void bf_logic_or(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
2056 {
2057  bf_logic_op(r, a, b, BF_LOGIC_OR);
2058 }
2059 
2060 /* 'a' and 'b' must be integers */
2061 void bf_logic_xor(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
2062 {
2063  bf_logic_op(r, a, b, BF_LOGIC_XOR);
2064 }
2065 
2066 /* 'a' and 'b' must be integers */
2067 void bf_logic_and(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, const bf_t *b)
2068 {
2069  bf_logic_op(r, a, b, BF_LOGIC_AND);
2070 }

2072 /* conversion between fixed size types */
2073 
2074 typedef union {
2075  double d;
2076  uint64_t u;
2077 } Float64Union;
2078 
2079 int bf_get_float64(const bf_t *a, double *pres, bf_rnd_t rnd_mode)
2080 {
2081  Float64Union u;
2082  int e, ret;
2083  uint64_t m;
2084 
2085  ret = 0;
2086  if (a->expn == BF_EXP_NAN) {
2087  u.u = 0x7ff8000000000000; /* quiet nan */
2088  } else {
2089  bf_t b_s, *b = &b_s;
2090 
2091  bf_init(a->ctx, b);
2092  bf_set(b, a);
2093  if (bf_is_finite(b)) {
2094  ret = bf_round(b, 53, rnd_mode | BF_FLAG_SUBNORMAL | bf_set_exp_bits(11));
2095  }
2096  if (b->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
2097  e = (1 << 11) - 1;
2098  m = 0;
2099  } else if (b->expn == BF_EXP_ZERO) {
2100  e = 0;
2101  m = 0;
2102  } else {
2103  e = b->expn + 1023 - 1;
2104 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
2105  if (b->len == 2) {
2106  m = ((uint64_t)b->tab[1] << 32) | b->tab[0];
2107  } else {
2108  m = ((uint64_t)b->tab[0] << 32);
2109  }
2110 #else
2111  m = b->tab[0];
2112 #endif
2113  if (e <= 0) {
2114  /* subnormal */
2115  m = m >> (12 - e);
2116  e = 0;
2117  } else {
2118  m = (m << 1) >> 12;
2119  }
2120  }
2121  u.u = m | ((uint64_t)e << 52) | ((uint64_t)b->sign << 63);
2122  bf_delete(b);
2123  }
2124  *pres = u.d;
2125  return ret;
2126 }
2127 
2128 void bf_set_float64(bf_t *a, double d)
2129 {
2130  Float64Union u;
2131  uint64_t m;
2132  int shift, e, sgn;
2133 
2134  u.d = d;
2135  sgn = u.u >> 63;
2136  e = (u.u >> 52) & ((1 << 11) - 1);
2137  m = u.u & (((uint64_t)1 << 52) - 1);
2138  if (e == ((1 << 11) - 1)) {
2139  if (m != 0) {
2140  bf_set_nan(a);
2141  } else {
2142  bf_set_inf(a, sgn);
2143  }
2144  } else if (e == 0) {
2145  if (m == 0) {
2146  bf_set_zero(a, sgn);
2147  } else {
2148  /* subnormal number */
2149  m <<= 12;
2150  shift = clz64(m);
2151  m <<= shift;
2152  e = -shift;
2153  goto norm;
2154  }
2155  } else {
2156  m = (m << 11) | ((uint64_t)1 << 63);
2157  norm:
2158  a->expn = e - 1023 + 1;
2159 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
2160  bf_resize(a, 2);
2161  a->tab[0] = m;
2162  a->tab[1] = m >> 32;
2163 #else
2164  bf_resize(a, 1);
2165  a->tab[0] = m;
2166 #endif
2167  a->sign = sgn;
2168  }
2169 }
2170 
2171 /* The rounding mode is always BF_RNDZ. Return BF_ST_OVERFLOW if there
2172  is an overflow and 0 otherwise. */
2173 int bf_get_int32(int *pres, const bf_t *a, int flags)
2174 {
2175  uint32_t v;
2176  int ret;
2177  if (a->expn >= BF_EXP_INF) {
2178  ret = 0;
2179  if (flags & BF_GET_INT_MOD) {
2180  v = 0;
2181  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
2182  v = (uint32_t)INT32_MAX + a->sign;
2183  } else {
2184  v = INT32_MAX;
2185  }
2186  } else if (a->expn <= 0) {
2187  v = 0;
2188  ret = 0;
2189  } else if (a->expn <= 31) {
2190  v = a->tab[a->len - 1] >> (LIMB_BITS - a->expn);
2191  if (a->sign)
2192  v = -v;
2193  ret = 0;
2194  } else if (!(flags & BF_GET_INT_MOD)) {
2195  ret = BF_ST_OVERFLOW;
2196  if (a->sign) {
2197  v = (uint32_t)INT32_MAX + 1;
2198  if (a->expn == 32 &&
2199  (a->tab[a->len - 1] >> (LIMB_BITS - 32)) == v) {
2200  ret = 0;
2201  }
2202  } else {
2203  v = INT32_MAX;
2204  }
2205  } else {
2206  v = get_bits(a->tab, a->len, a->len * LIMB_BITS - a->expn);
2207  if (a->sign)
2208  v = -v;
2209  ret = 0;
2210  }
2211  *pres = v;
2212  return ret;
2213 }
2214 
2215 /* The rounding mode is always BF_RNDZ. Return BF_ST_OVERFLOW if there
2216  is an overflow and 0 otherwise. */
2217 int bf_get_int64(int64_t *pres, const bf_t *a, int flags)
2218 {
2219  uint64_t v;
2220  int ret;
2221  if (a->expn >= BF_EXP_INF) {
2222  ret = 0;
2223  if (flags & BF_GET_INT_MOD) {
2224  v = 0;
2225  } else if (a->expn == BF_EXP_INF) {
2226  v = (uint64_t)INT64_MAX + a->sign;
2227  } else {
2228  v = INT64_MAX;
2229  }
2230  } else if (a->expn <= 0) {
2231  v = 0;
2232  ret = 0;
2233  } else if (a->expn <= 63) {
2234 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
2235  if (a->expn <= 32)
2236  v = a->tab[a->len - 1] >> (LIMB_BITS - a->expn);
2237  else
2238  v = (((uint64_t)a->tab[a->len - 1] << 32) |
2239  get_limbz(a, a->len - 2)) >> (64 - a->expn);
2240 #else
2241  v = a->tab[a->len - 1] >> (LIMB_BITS - a->expn);
2242 #endif
2243  if (a->sign)
2244  v = -v;
2245  ret = 0;
2246  } else if (!(flags & BF_GET_INT_MOD)) {
2247  ret = BF_ST_OVERFLOW;
2248  if (a->sign) {
2249  uint64_t v1;
2250  v = (uint64_t)INT64_MAX + 1;
2251  if (a->expn == 64) {
2252  v1 = a->tab[a->len - 1];
2253 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
2254  v1 |= (v1 << 32) | get_limbz(a, a->len - 2);
2255 #endif
2256  if (v1 == v)
2257  ret = 0;
2258  }
2259  } else {
2260  v = INT64_MAX;
2261  }
2262  } else {
2263  slimb_t bit_pos = a->len * LIMB_BITS - a->expn;
2264  v = get_bits(a->tab, a->len, bit_pos);
2265 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
2266  v |= (uint64_t)get_bits(a->tab, a->len, bit_pos + 32) << 32;
2267 #endif
2268  if (a->sign)
2269  v = -v;
2270  ret = 0;
2271  }
2272  *pres = v;
2273  return ret;
2274 }

2276 /* base conversion from radix */
2277 
2278 static const uint8_t digits_per_limb_table[BF_RADIX_MAX - 1] = {
2279 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
2280 32,20,16,13,12,11,10,10, 9, 9, 8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6,
2281 #else
2282 64,40,32,27,24,22,21,20,19,18,17,17,16,16,16,15,15,15,14,14,14,14,13,13,13,13,13,13,13,12,12,12,12,12,12,
2283 #endif
2284 };
2285 
2286 static limb_t get_limb_radix(int radix)
2287 {
2288  int i, k;
2289  limb_t radixl;
2290 
2291  k = digits_per_limb_table[radix - 2];
2292  radixl = radix;
2293  for(i = 1; i < k; i++)
2294  radixl *= radix;
2295  return radixl;
2296 }
2297 
2298 static void bf_integer_from_radix_rec(bf_t *r, const limb_t *tab,
2299  limb_t n, int level, limb_t n0,
2300  limb_t radix, bf_t *pow_tab)
2301 {
2302  if (n == 1) {
2303  bf_set_ui(r, tab[0]);
2304  } else {
2305  bf_t T_s, *T = &T_s, *B;
2306  limb_t n1, n2;
2307 
2308  n2 = (((n0 * 2) >> (level + 1)) + 1) / 2;
2309  n1 = n - n2;
2310  // printf("level=%d n0=%ld n1=%ld n2=%ld\n", level, n0, n1, n2);
2311  B = &pow_tab[level];
2312  if (B->len == 0) {
2313  bf_pow_ui_ui(B, radix, n2, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
2314  }
2315  bf_integer_from_radix_rec(r, tab + n2, n1, level + 1, n0,
2316  radix, pow_tab);
2317  bf_mul(r, r, B, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
2318  bf_init(r->ctx, T);
2319  bf_integer_from_radix_rec(T, tab, n2, level + 1, n0,
2320  radix, pow_tab);
2321  bf_add(r, r, T, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
2322  bf_delete(T);
2323  }
2324  // bf_print_str(" r=", r);
2325 }
2326 
2327 static void bf_integer_from_radix(bf_t *r, const limb_t *tab,
2328  limb_t n, limb_t radix)
2329 {
2330  bf_context_t *s = r->ctx;
2331  int pow_tab_len, i;
2332  limb_t radixl;
2333  bf_t *pow_tab;
2334 
2335  radixl = get_limb_radix(radix);
2336  pow_tab_len = ceil_log2(n) + 2; /* XXX: check */
2337  pow_tab = bf_malloc(s, sizeof(pow_tab[0]) * pow_tab_len);
2338  for(i = 0; i < pow_tab_len; i++)
2339  bf_init(r->ctx, &pow_tab[i]);
2340  bf_integer_from_radix_rec(r, tab, n, 0, n, radixl, pow_tab);
2341  for(i = 0; i < pow_tab_len; i++) {
2342  bf_delete(&pow_tab[i]);
2343  }
2344  bf_free(s, pow_tab);
2345 }
2346 
2347 /* compute and round T * radix^expn. */
2348 int bf_mul_pow_radix(bf_t *r, const bf_t *T, limb_t radix,
2349  slimb_t expn, limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags)
2350 {
2351  int ret, expn_sign, overflow;
2352  slimb_t e, extra_bits, prec1, ziv_extra_bits;
2353  bf_t B_s, *B = &B_s;
2354 
2355  if (T->len == 0) {
2356  bf_set(r, T);
2357  return 0;
2358  } else if (expn == 0) {
2359  bf_set(r, T);
2360  return bf_round(r, prec, flags);
2361  }
2362 
2363  e = expn;
2364  expn_sign = 0;
2365  if (e < 0) {
2366  e = -e;
2367  expn_sign = 1;
2368  }
2369  bf_init(r->ctx, B);
2370  if (prec == BF_PREC_INF) {
2371  /* infinite precision: only used if the result is known to be exact */
2372  bf_pow_ui_ui(B, radix, e, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDN);
2373  if (expn_sign) {
2374  ret = bf_div(r, T, B, T->len * LIMB_BITS, BF_RNDN);
2375  } else {
2376  ret = bf_mul(r, T, B, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDN);
2377  }
2378  } else {
2379  ziv_extra_bits = 16;
2380  for(;;) {
2381  prec1 = prec + ziv_extra_bits;
2382  /* XXX: correct overflow/underflow handling */
2383  /* XXX: rigorous error analysis needed */
2384  extra_bits = ceil_log2(e) * 2 + 1;
2385  ret = bf_pow_ui_ui(B, radix, e, prec1 + extra_bits, BF_RNDN);
2386  overflow = !bf_is_finite(B);
2387  /* XXX: if bf_pow_ui_ui returns an exact result, can stop
2388  after the next operation */
2389  if (expn_sign)
2390  ret |= bf_div(r, T, B, prec1 + extra_bits, BF_RNDN);
2391  else
2392  ret |= bf_mul(r, T, B, prec1 + extra_bits, BF_RNDN);
2393  if ((ret & BF_ST_INEXACT) &&
2394  !bf_can_round(r, prec, flags & BF_RND_MASK, prec1) &&
2395  !overflow) {
2396  /* and more precision and retry */
2397  ziv_extra_bits = ziv_extra_bits + (ziv_extra_bits / 2);
2398  } else {
2399  ret = bf_round(r, prec, flags) | (ret & BF_ST_INEXACT);
2400  break;
2401  }
2402  }
2403  }
2404  bf_delete(B);
2405  return ret;
2406 }
2407 
2408 static inline int to_digit(int c)
2409 {
2410  if (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
2411  return c - '0';
2412  else if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')
2413  return c - 'A' + 10;
2414  else if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')
2415  return c - 'a' + 10;
2416  else
2417  return 36;
2418 }
2419 
2420 /* add a limb at 'pos' and decrement pos. new space is created if needed */
2421 static void bf_add_limb(bf_t *a, slimb_t *ppos, limb_t v)
2422 {
2423  slimb_t pos;
2424  pos = *ppos;
2425  if (unlikely(pos < 0)) {
2426  limb_t new_size, d;
2427  new_size = bf_max(a->len + 1, a->len * 3 / 2);
2428  a->tab = bf_realloc(a->ctx, a->tab, sizeof(limb_t) * new_size);
2429  d = new_size - a->len;
2430  memmove(a->tab + d, a->tab, a->len * sizeof(limb_t));
2431  a->len = new_size;
2432  pos += d;
2433  }
2434  a->tab[pos--] = v;
2435  *ppos = pos;
2436 }
2437 
2438 static int bf_tolower(int c)
2439 {
2440  if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')
2441  c = c - 'A' + 'a';
2442  return c;
2443 }
2444 
2445 static int strcasestart(const char *str, const char *val, const char **ptr)
2446 {
2447  const char *p, *q;
2448  p = str;
2449  q = val;
2450  while (*q != '\0') {
2451  if (bf_tolower(*p) != *q)
2452  return 0;
2453  p++;
2454  q++;
2455  }
2456  if (ptr)
2457  *ptr = p;
2458  return 1;
2459 }
2460 
2461 /*
2462  Return (status, n, exp). 'status' is the floating point status. 'n'
2463  is the parsed number.
2464  If prec = BF_PREC_INF:
2465  If the number is an integer or if the radix is a power of two,
2466  *pexponent = 0.
2467  Otherwise, '*pexponent' is the exponent in radix 'radix'.
2468  Otherwise
2469  *pexponent = 0
2470 */
2471 int bf_atof2(bf_t *r, slimb_t *pexponent,
2472  const char *str, const char **pnext, int radix,
2473  limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags)
2474 {
2475  const char *p, *p_start;
2476  int is_neg, radix_bits, exp_is_neg, ret, digits_per_limb, shift, sep;
2477  int ret_legacy_octal = 0;
2478  limb_t cur_limb;
2479  slimb_t pos, expn, int_len, digit_count;
2480  BOOL has_decpt, is_bin_exp, is_float;
2481  bf_t a_s, *a;
2482 
2483  /* optional separator between digits */
2484  sep = (flags & BF_ATOF_UNDERSCORE_SEP) ? '_' : 256;
2485 
2486  *pexponent = 0;
2487  p = str;
2488  if (!(flags & (BF_ATOF_INT_ONLY | BF_ATOF_JS_QUIRKS)) &&
2489  radix <= 16 &&
2490  strcasestart(p, "nan", &p)) {
2491  bf_set_nan(r);
2492  ret = 0;
2493  goto done;
2494  }
2495  is_neg = 0;
2496 
2497  if (p[0] == '+') {
2498  p++;
2499  p_start = p;
2500  if (flags & BF_ATOF_NO_PREFIX_AFTER_SIGN)
2501  goto no_radix_prefix;
2502  } else if (p[0] == '-') {
2503  is_neg = 1;
2504  p++;
2505  p_start = p;
2506  if (flags & BF_ATOF_NO_PREFIX_AFTER_SIGN)
2507  goto no_radix_prefix;
2508  } else {
2509  p_start = p;
2510  }
2511  if (p[0] == '0') {
2512  if ((p[1] == 'x' || p[1] == 'X') &&
2513  (radix == 0 || radix == 16) &&
2514  !(flags & BF_ATOF_NO_HEX)) {
2515  radix = 16;
2516  p += 2;
2517  } else if ((p[1] == 'o' || p[1] == 'O') &&
2518  radix == 0 && (flags & BF_ATOF_BIN_OCT)) {
2519  p += 2;
2520  radix = 8;
2521  } else if ((p[1] == 'b' || p[1] == 'B') &&
2522  radix == 0 && (flags & BF_ATOF_BIN_OCT)) {
2523  p += 2;
2524  radix = 2;
2525  } else if ((p[1] >= '0' && p[1] <= '9') &&
2526  radix == 0 && (flags & BF_ATOF_LEGACY_OCTAL)) {
2527  int i;
2528  ret_legacy_octal = BF_ATOF_ST_LEGACY_OCTAL;
2529  /* the separator is not allowed in legacy octal literals */
2530  sep = 256;
2531  for (i = 1; (p[i] >= '0' && p[i] <= '7'); i++)
2532  continue;
2533  if (p[i] == '8' || p[i] == '9')
2534  goto no_prefix;
2535  p += 1;
2536  radix = 8;
2537  } else {
2538  /* 0 cannot be followed by a separator */
2539  if (p[1] == sep) {
2540  p++;
2541  bf_set_zero(r, 0);
2542  ret = 0;
2543  if (flags & BF_ATOF_INT_PREC_INF)
2544  ret |= BF_ATOF_ST_INTEGER;
2545  goto done;
2546  }
2547  goto no_prefix;
2548  }
2549  /* there must be a digit after the prefix */
2550  if (to_digit((uint8_t)*p) >= radix) {
2551  bf_set_nan(r);
2552  ret = 0;
2553  goto done;
2554  }
2555  no_prefix: ;
2556  } else {
2557  no_radix_prefix:
2558  if (!(flags & BF_ATOF_INT_ONLY) && radix <= 16 &&
2559  ((!(flags & BF_ATOF_JS_QUIRKS) && strcasestart(p, "inf", &p)) ||
2560  ((flags & BF_ATOF_JS_QUIRKS) && strstart(p, "Infinity", &p)))) {
2561  bf_set_inf(r, is_neg);
2562  ret = 0;
2563  goto done;
2564  }
2565  }
2566 
2567  if (radix == 0)
2568  radix = 10;
2569  if ((radix & (radix - 1)) != 0) {
2570  radix_bits = 0; /* base is not a power of two */
2571  a = &a_s;
2572  bf_init(r->ctx, a);
2573  } else {
2574  radix_bits = ceil_log2(radix);
2575  a = r;
2576  }
2577 
2578  /* skip leading zeros */
2579  /* XXX: could also skip zeros after the decimal point */
2580  while (*p == '0' || (*p == sep && to_digit(p[1]) < radix))
2581  p++;
2582 
2583  if (radix_bits) {
2584  shift = digits_per_limb = LIMB_BITS;
2585  } else {
2586  radix_bits = 0;
2587  shift = digits_per_limb = digits_per_limb_table[radix - 2];
2588  }
2589  cur_limb = 0;
2590  bf_resize(a, 1);
2591  pos = 0;
2592  has_decpt = FALSE;
2593  int_len = digit_count = 0;
2594  is_float = FALSE;
2595  for(;;) {
2596  limb_t c;
2597  if (*p == '.' && (p > p_start || to_digit(p[1]) < radix)) {
2598  if ((flags & BF_ATOF_INT_ONLY) ||
2599  (radix != 10 && (flags & BF_ATOF_ONLY_DEC_FLOAT)))
2600  break;
2601  if (has_decpt)
2602  break;
2603  is_float = TRUE;
2604  has_decpt = TRUE;
2605  int_len = digit_count;
2606  p++;
2607  }
2608  if (*p == sep && to_digit(p[1]) < radix)
2609  p++;
2610  c = to_digit(*p);
2611  if (c >= radix)
2612  break;
2613  digit_count++;
2614  p++;
2615  if (radix_bits) {
2616  shift -= radix_bits;
2617  if (shift <= 0) {
2618  cur_limb |= c >> (-shift);
2619  bf_add_limb(a, &pos, cur_limb);
2620  if (shift < 0)
2621  cur_limb = c << (LIMB_BITS + shift);
2622  else
2623  cur_limb = 0;
2624  shift += LIMB_BITS;
2625  } else {
2626  cur_limb |= c << shift;
2627  }
2628  } else {
2629  cur_limb = cur_limb * radix + c;
2630  shift--;
2631  if (shift == 0) {
2632  bf_add_limb(a, &pos, cur_limb);
2633  shift = digits_per_limb;
2634  cur_limb = 0;
2635  }
2636  }
2637  }
2638  if (!has_decpt)
2639  int_len = digit_count;
2640 
2641  /* add the last limb and pad with zeros */
2642  if (shift != digits_per_limb) {
2643  if (radix_bits == 0) {
2644  while (shift != 0) {
2645  cur_limb *= radix;
2646  shift--;
2647  }
2648  }
2649  bf_add_limb(a, &pos, cur_limb);
2650  }
2651 
2652  /* reset the next limbs to zero (we prefer to reallocate in the
2653  renormalization) */
2654  memset(a->tab, 0, (pos + 1) * sizeof(limb_t));
2655 
2656  if (p == p_start) {
2657  if (!radix_bits)
2658  bf_delete(a);
2659  ret = 0;
2660  bf_set_nan(r);
2661  goto done;
2662  }
2663 
2664  /* parse the exponent, if any */
2665  expn = 0;
2666  is_bin_exp = FALSE;
2667  if (!(flags & BF_ATOF_INT_ONLY) &&
2668  !(radix != 10 && (flags & BF_ATOF_ONLY_DEC_FLOAT)) &&
2669  ((radix == 10 && (*p == 'e' || *p == 'E')) ||
2670  (radix != 10 && (*p == '@' ||
2671  (radix_bits && (*p == 'p' || *p == 'P'))))) &&
2672  p > p_start) {
2673  is_bin_exp = (*p == 'p' || *p == 'P');
2674  p++;
2675  is_float = TRUE;
2676  exp_is_neg = 0;
2677  if (*p == '+') {
2678  p++;
2679  } else if (*p == '-') {
2680  exp_is_neg = 1;
2681  p++;
2682  }
2683  for(;;) {
2684  int c;
2685  if (*p == sep && to_digit(p[1]) < 10)
2686  p++;
2687  c = to_digit(*p);
2688  if (c >= 10)
2689  break;
2690  if (unlikely(expn > ((EXP_MAX - 2 - 9) / 10))) {
2691  /* exponent overflow */
2692  if (exp_is_neg) {
2693  bf_set_zero(r, is_neg);
2694  ret = BF_ST_UNDERFLOW | BF_ST_INEXACT;
2695  } else {
2696  bf_set_inf(r, is_neg);
2697  ret = BF_ST_OVERFLOW | BF_ST_INEXACT;
2698  }
2699  goto done;
2700  }
2701  p++;
2702  expn = expn * 10 + c;
2703  }
2704  if (exp_is_neg)
2705  expn = -expn;
2706  } else if (!is_float) {
2707  if (*p == 'n' && (flags & BF_ATOF_INT_N_SUFFIX)) {
2708  p++;
2709  prec = BF_PREC_INF;
2710  } else if (flags & BF_ATOF_INT_PREC_INF) {
2711  prec = BF_PREC_INF;
2712  } else {
2713  is_float = TRUE;
2714  }
2715  }
2716  if (radix_bits) {
2717  /* XXX: may overflow */
2718  if (!is_bin_exp)
2719  expn *= radix_bits;
2720  a->expn = expn + (int_len * radix_bits);
2721  a->sign = is_neg;
2722  ret = bf_normalize_and_round(a, prec, flags);
2723  } else {
2724  limb_t l;
2725  pos++;
2726  l = a->len - pos; /* number of limbs */
2727  if (l == 0) {
2728  bf_set_zero(r, is_neg);
2729  ret = 0;
2730  } else {
2731  bf_t T_s, *T = &T_s;
2732 
2733  expn -= l * digits_per_limb - int_len;
2734  bf_init(r->ctx, T);
2735  bf_integer_from_radix(T, a->tab + pos, l, radix);
2736  T->sign = is_neg;
2737  if (prec == BF_PREC_INF && is_float) {
2738  /* return the exponent */
2739  *pexponent = expn;
2740  bf_set(r, T);
2741  ret = 0;
2742  } else {
2743  ret = bf_mul_pow_radix(r, T, radix, expn, prec, flags);
2744  }
2745  bf_delete(T);
2746  }
2747  bf_delete(a);
2748  }
2749  if (!is_float)
2750  ret |= BF_ATOF_ST_INTEGER;
2751  done:
2752  if (pnext)
2753  *pnext = p;
2754  return ret | ret_legacy_octal;
2755 }
2756 
2757 int bf_atof(bf_t *r, const char *str, const char **pnext, int radix,
2758  limb_t prec, bf_flags_t flags)
2759 {
2760  slimb_t dummy_exp;
2761  return bf_atof2(r, &dummy_exp, str, pnext, radix, prec, flags);
2762 }

2924 /* compute floor(a*b) or ceil(a*b) with b = log2(radix) or
2925  b=1/log2(radix). For is_inv = 0, strict accuracy is not guaranteed
2926  when radix is not a power of two. */
2927 slimb_t bf_mul_log2_radix(slimb_t a1, unsigned int radix, int is_inv,
2928  int is_ceil1)
2929 {
2930  int is_neg;
2931  limb_t a;
2932  BOOL is_ceil;
2933 
2934  is_ceil = is_ceil1;
2935  a = a1;
2936  if (a1 < 0) {
2937  a = -a;
2938  is_neg = 1;
2939  } else {
2940  is_neg = 0;
2941  }
2942  is_ceil ^= is_neg;
2943  if ((radix & (radix - 1)) == 0) {
2944  int radix_bits;
2945  /* radix is a power of two */
2946  radix_bits = ceil_log2(radix);
2947  if (is_inv) {
2948  if (is_ceil)
2949  a += radix_bits - 1;
2950  a = a / radix_bits;
2951  } else {
2952  a = a * radix_bits;
2953  }
2954  } else {
2955  const uint32_t *tab;
2956  limb_t b0, b1;
2957  dlimb_t t;
2958 
2959  if (is_inv) {
2960  tab = inv_log2_radix[radix - 2];
2961 #if LIMB_BITS == 32
2962  b1 = tab[0];
2963  b0 = tab[1];
2964 #else
2965  b1 = ((limb_t)tab[0] << 32) | tab[1];
2966  b0 = (limb_t)tab[2] << 32;
2967 #endif
2968  t = (dlimb_t)b0 * (dlimb_t)a;
2969  t = (dlimb_t)b1 * (dlimb_t)a + (t >> LIMB_BITS);
2970  a = t >> (LIMB_BITS - 1);
2971  } else {
2972  b0 = log2_radix[radix - 2];
2973  t = (dlimb_t)b0 * (dlimb_t)a;
2974  a = t >> (LIMB_BITS - 3);
2975  }
2976  /* a = floor(result) and 'result' cannot be an integer */
2977  a += is_ceil;
2978  }
2979  if (is_neg)
2980  a = -a;
2981  return a;
2982 }
2983 
2984 /* 'n' is the number of output limbs */
2985 static void bf_integer_to_radix_rec(bf_t *pow_tab,
2986  limb_t *out, const bf_t *a, limb_t n,
2987  int level, limb_t n0, limb_t radixl,
2988  unsigned int radixl_bits)
2989 {
2990  limb_t n1, n2, q_prec;
2991  assert(n >= 1);
2992  if (n == 1) {
2993  out[0] = get_bits(a->tab, a->len, a->len * LIMB_BITS - a->expn);
2994  } else if (n == 2) {
2995  dlimb_t t;
2996  slimb_t pos;
2997  pos = a->len * LIMB_BITS - a->expn;
2998  t = ((dlimb_t)get_bits(a->tab, a->len, pos + LIMB_BITS) << LIMB_BITS) |
2999  get_bits(a->tab, a->len, pos);
3000  if (likely(radixl == RADIXL_10)) {
3001  /* use division by a constant when possible */
3002  out[0] = t % RADIXL_10;
3003  out[1] = t / RADIXL_10;
3004  } else {
3005  out[0] = t % radixl;
3006  out[1] = t / radixl;
3007  }
3008  } else {
3009  bf_t Q, R, *B, *B_inv;
3010  int q_add;
3011  bf_init(a->ctx, &Q);
3012  bf_init(a->ctx, &R);
3013  n2 = (((n0 * 2) >> (level + 1)) + 1) / 2;
3014  n1 = n - n2;
3015  B = &pow_tab[2 * level];
3016  B_inv = &pow_tab[2 * level + 1];
3017  if (B->len == 0) {
3018  /* compute BASE^n2 */
3019  bf_pow_ui_ui(B, radixl, n2, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
3020  /* we use enough bits for the maximum possible 'n1' value,
3021  i.e. n2 + 1 */
3022  bf_recip(B_inv, B, (n2 + 1) * radixl_bits + 2);
3023  }
3024  // printf("%d: n1=% " PRId64 " n2=%" PRId64 "\n", level, n1, n2);
3025  q_prec = n1 * radixl_bits;
3026  bf_mul(&Q, a, B_inv, q_prec, BF_RNDN);
3027  bf_rint(&Q, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
3028 
3029  bf_mul(&R, &Q, B, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
3030  bf_sub(&R, a, &R, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
3031  /* adjust if necessary */
3032  q_add = 0;
3033  while (R.sign && R.len != 0) {
3034  bf_add(&R, &R, B, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
3035  q_add--;
3036  }
3037  while (bf_cmpu(&R, B) >= 0) {
3038  bf_sub(&R, &R, B, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
3039  q_add++;
3040  }
3041  if (q_add != 0) {
3042  bf_add_si(&Q, &Q, q_add, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
3043  }
3044  bf_integer_to_radix_rec(pow_tab, out + n2, &Q, n1, level + 1, n0,
3045  radixl, radixl_bits);
3046  bf_integer_to_radix_rec(pow_tab, out, &R, n2, level + 1, n0,
3047  radixl, radixl_bits);
3048  bf_delete(&Q);
3049  bf_delete(&R);
3050  }
3051 }
3052 
3053 static void bf_integer_to_radix(bf_t *r, const bf_t *a, limb_t radixl)
3054 {
3055  bf_context_t *s = r->ctx;
3056  limb_t r_len;
3057  bf_t *pow_tab;
3058  int i, pow_tab_len;
3059 
3060  r_len = r->len;
3061  pow_tab_len = (ceil_log2(r_len) + 2) * 2; /* XXX: check */
3062  pow_tab = bf_malloc(s, sizeof(pow_tab[0]) * pow_tab_len);
3063  for(i = 0; i < pow_tab_len; i++)
3064  bf_init(r->ctx, &pow_tab[i]);
3065 
3066  bf_integer_to_radix_rec(pow_tab, r->tab, a, r_len, 0, r_len, radixl,
3067  ceil_log2(radixl));
3068 
3069  for(i = 0; i < pow_tab_len; i++) {
3070  bf_delete(&pow_tab[i]);
3071  }
3072  bf_free(s, pow_tab);
3073 }
3074 
3075 /* a must be >= 0. 'P' is the wanted number of digits in radix
3076  'radix'. 'r' is the mantissa represented as an integer. *pE
3077  contains the exponent. */
3078 static void bf_convert_to_radix(bf_t *r, slimb_t *pE,
3079  const bf_t *a, int radix,
3080  limb_t P, bf_rnd_t rnd_mode,
3081  BOOL is_fixed_exponent)
3082 {
3083  slimb_t E, e, prec, extra_bits, ziv_extra_bits, prec0;
3084  bf_t B_s, *B = &B_s;
3085  int e_sign, ret, res;
3086 
3087  if (a->len == 0) {
3088  /* zero case */
3089  *pE = 0;
3090  bf_set(r, a);
3091  return;
3092  }
3093 
3094  if (is_fixed_exponent) {
3095  E = *pE;
3096  } else {
3097  /* compute the new exponent */
3098  E = 1 + bf_mul_log2_radix(a->expn - 1, radix, TRUE, FALSE);
3099  }
3100  // bf_print_str("a", a);
3101  // printf("E=%ld P=%ld radix=%d\n", E, P, radix);
3102 
3103  for(;;) {
3104  e = P - E;
3105  e_sign = 0;
3106  if (e < 0) {
3107  e = -e;
3108  e_sign = 1;
3109  }
3110  /* Note: precision for log2(radix) is not critical here */
3111  prec0 = bf_mul_log2_radix(P, radix, FALSE, TRUE);
3112  ziv_extra_bits = 16;
3113  for(;;) {
3114  prec = prec0 + ziv_extra_bits;
3115  /* XXX: rigorous error analysis needed */
3116  extra_bits = ceil_log2(e) * 2 + 1;
3117  ret = bf_pow_ui_ui(r, radix, e, prec + extra_bits, BF_RNDN);
3118  if (!e_sign)
3119  ret |= bf_mul(r, r, a, prec + extra_bits, BF_RNDN);
3120  else
3121  ret |= bf_div(r, a, r, prec + extra_bits, BF_RNDN);
3122  /* if the result is not exact, check that it can be safely
3123  rounded to an integer */
3124  if ((ret & BF_ST_INEXACT) &&
3125  !bf_can_round(r, r->expn, rnd_mode, prec)) {
3126  /* and more precision and retry */
3127  ziv_extra_bits = ziv_extra_bits + (ziv_extra_bits / 2);
3128  continue;
3129  } else {
3130  bf_rint(r, BF_PREC_INF, rnd_mode);
3131  break;
3132  }
3133  }
3134  if (is_fixed_exponent)
3135  break;
3136  /* check that the result is < B^P */
3137  /* XXX: do an fast approximate test first ? */
3138  bf_init(r->ctx, B);
3139  bf_pow_ui_ui(B, radix, P, BF_PREC_INF, BF_RNDZ);
3140  res = bf_cmpu(r, B);
3141  bf_delete(B);
3142  if (res < 0)
3143  break;
3144  /* try a larger exponent */
3145  E++;
3146  }
3147  *pE = E;
3148 }
3149 
3150 static void limb_to_a(char *buf, limb_t n, unsigned int radix, int len)
3151 {
3152  int digit, i;
3153 
3154  if (radix == 10) {
3155  /* specific case with constant divisor */
3156  for(i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
3157  digit = (limb_t)n % 10;
3158  n = (limb_t)n / 10;
3159  buf[i] = digit + '0';
3160  }
3161  } else {
3162  for(i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
3163  digit = (limb_t)n % radix;
3164  n = (limb_t)n / radix;
3165  if (digit < 10)
3166  digit += '0';
3167  else
3168  digit += 'a' - 10;
3169  buf[i] = digit;
3170  }
3171  }
3172 }
3173 
3174 /* for power of 2 radixes */
3175 static void limb_to_a2(char *buf, limb_t n, unsigned int radix_bits, int len)
3176 {
3177  int digit, i;
3178  unsigned int mask;
3179 
3180  mask = (1 << radix_bits) - 1;
3181  for(i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
3182  digit = n & mask;
3183  n >>= radix_bits;
3184  if (digit < 10)
3185  digit += '0';
3186  else
3187  digit += 'a' - 10;
3188  buf[i] = digit;
3189  }
3190 }
3191 
3192 /* 'a' must be an integer. A dot is added before the 'dot_pos'
3193  digit. dot_pos = n_digits does not display the dot. 0 <= dot_pos <=
3194  n_digits. n_digits >= 1. */
3195 static void output_digits(DynBuf *s, const bf_t *a1, int radix, limb_t n_digits,
3196  limb_t dot_pos)
3197 {
3198  limb_t i, v, l;
3199  slimb_t pos, pos_incr;
3200  int digits_per_limb, buf_pos, radix_bits, first_buf_pos;
3201  char buf[65];
3202  bf_t a_s, *a;
3203 
3204  if ((radix & (radix - 1)) != 0) {
3205  limb_t n, radixl;
3206 
3207  digits_per_limb = digits_per_limb_table[radix - 2];
3208  radixl = get_limb_radix(radix);
3209  a = &a_s;
3210  bf_init(a1->ctx, a);
3211  n = (n_digits + digits_per_limb - 1) / digits_per_limb;
3212  bf_resize(a, n);
3213  bf_integer_to_radix(a, a1, radixl);
3214  radix_bits = 0;
3215  pos = n;
3216  pos_incr = 1;
3217  first_buf_pos = pos * digits_per_limb - n_digits;
3218  } else {
3219  a = (bf_t *)a1;
3220  radix_bits = ceil_log2(radix);
3221  digits_per_limb = LIMB_BITS / radix_bits;
3222  pos_incr = digits_per_limb * radix_bits;
3223  pos = a->len * LIMB_BITS - a->expn + n_digits * radix_bits;
3224  first_buf_pos = 0;
3225  }
3226  buf_pos = digits_per_limb;
3227  i = 0;
3228  while (i < n_digits) {
3229  if (buf_pos == digits_per_limb) {
3230  pos -= pos_incr;
3231  if (radix_bits == 0) {
3232  v = get_limbz(a, pos);
3233  limb_to_a(buf, v, radix, digits_per_limb);
3234  } else {
3235  v = get_bits(a->tab, a->len, pos);
3236  limb_to_a2(buf, v, radix_bits, digits_per_limb);
3237  }
3238  buf_pos = first_buf_pos;
3239  first_buf_pos = 0;
3240  }
3241  if (i < dot_pos) {
3242  l = dot_pos;
3243  } else {
3244  if (i == dot_pos)
3245  dbuf_putc(s, '.');
3246  l = n_digits;
3247  }
3248  l = bf_min(digits_per_limb - buf_pos, l - i);
3249  dbuf_put(s, (uint8_t *)(buf + buf_pos), l);
3250  buf_pos += l;
3251  i += l;
3252  }
3253  if (a != a1)
3254  bf_delete(a);
3255 }
3256 
3257 static void *bf_dbuf_realloc(void *opaque, void *ptr, size_t size)
3258 {
3259  bf_context_t *s = opaque;
3260  return bf_realloc(s, ptr, size);
3261 }
